intro: Ranunculus alpestris, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It features showy yellow flowers with 5 to 15 sepals that resemble petals, and it typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows. The plant has a short, stout stem and basal leaves that are deeply lobed or divided. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Ranunculus alpestris is often found in high-altitude environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
